questiontext.text:
A random procedure generated the following sample (sequence of measurements):

x=40,44,44,48,40,49,49,47,46,41\mathbf{x} = 40, 44, 44, 48, 40, 49, 49, 47, 46, 41

You can download the data as a CSV file (for importing into a spreadsheet or R): list_counting_basic_data_21656.csv

  1. How many of the measurements are less than 40? In other words, determine #[x<40]\#[\mathbf{x}<40]. {1:NUMERICAL:=0:0}
  2. How many of the measurements are less than or equal to 49? In other words, determine #[x≤49]\#[\mathbf{x}\le49]. {1:NUMERICAL:=10:0}
  3. How many of the measurements are greater than 47? In other words, determine #[x>47]\#[\mathbf{x}>47]. {1:NUMERICAL:=3:0}
  4. How many of the measurements are greater than or equal to 41? In other words, determine #[x≥41]\#[\mathbf{x}\ge41]. {1:NUMERICAL:=8:0}
  5. If 0 of the measurements are less than xcx_{\text{c}}, and xcx_{\text{c}} is a measurement from sample x\mathbf{x}, then what is xcx_{\text{c}}? In other words, determine a measurement xcx_{\text{c}} from sequence x\mathbf{x} such that #[x<xc]=0\#[\mathbf{x}<x_{\text{c}}] = 0. {1:NUMERICAL:=40:0}
  6. If 5 of the measurements are less than or equal to xcx_{\text{c}}, and xcx_{\text{c}} is a measurement from sample x\mathbf{x}, then what is xcx_{\text{c}}? In other words, determine a measurement xcx_{\text{c}} from sequence x\mathbf{x} such that #[x≤xc]=5\#[\mathbf{x}\le x_{\text{c}}] = 5. {1:NUMERICAL:=44:0}
  7. If 5 of the measurements are greater than xcx_{\text{c}}, and xcx_{\text{c}} is a measurement from sample x\mathbf{x}, then what is xcx_{\text{c}}? In other words, determine a measurement xcx_{\text{c}} from sequence x\mathbf{x} such that #[x>xc]=5\#[\mathbf{x}>x_{\text{c}}] = 5. {1:NUMERICAL:=44:0}
  8. If 5 of the measurements are greater than or equal to xcx_{\text{c}}, and xcx_{\text{c}} is a measurement from sample x\mathbf{x}, then what is xcx_{\text{c}}? In other words, determine a measurement xcx_{\text{c}} from sequence x\mathbf{x} such that #[x≥xc]=5\#[\mathbf{x}\ge x_{\text{c}}] = 5. {1:NUMERICAL:=46:0}
